io.py¶

class anduryl.io.ProjectIO(project)[source]¶

Bases: object

IO class for anduryl project

add_data(outdict)[source]¶

Adds data to project from loaded dictionary

Parameters

outdict (dictionary) – Dictionary with loaded input data

load_excalibur(dttfile, rlsfile)[source]¶

Load Excalibur file format

Parameters

  • dttfile (str) – Path to.dtt file

  • rlsfile (str) – Path to .rls file

load_file(path)[source]¶

Loads file given a file name. The load function of excalbur or json is called based on the extension.

Parameters

path (str) – Path to file

load_json(path)[source]¶

Load json file format

Parameters

path (str) – Path to .json file

to_excalibur(dttfile)[source]¶

Save to Excalibur format

Parameters

dttfile (str) – .dtt file for excalibur. .rls file is derived from the name by replacing the extension

to_file(path)[source]¶

Saves project to file, calls the save function dependend on the path extension

Parameters

path (str) – Path to save file

to_json(path)[source]¶

Save project to json

Parameters

path (str) – Path to json file

anduryl.io.dict_to_elements(dct)[source]¶

Create a (nested) list from a dictionary

Parameters

dct (dictionary) – Dictionary to reshape into lists

Returns

Labels and elements

Return type

list, list

anduryl.io.elements_to_dict(arr, labels, level=0)[source]¶

Functionn to map array of list elements to dictionary

Parameters

  • arr (np.ndarray or lists) – Elements to be ravelled to dict

  • labels (list) – labels for each ‘axis’ of the arr

  • level (int, optional) – Level of depth, used by the function itself when nesting, by default 0

Returns

array as ravelled dictionary

Return type

dictionary

anduryl.io.get_table_text(model, newline='\n', delimiter='\t')[source]¶

Get all elements from table model, including the header

Parameters

  • selection (Qt selection) – Selection from a table

  • newline (str, optional) – character for newline, by default n

  • delimiter (str, optional) – character for delimiter, by default t

Returns

Text that can be exported or pasted

Return type

str

anduryl.io.read_excalibur(dttfile, rlsfile)[source]¶

Function to read assessment from Excalibur .ddt and .rls file

Parameters

  • dttfile (str) – File with assessments

  • rlsfile (str) – File with realisations

Parameters

path (str) – Path to json file

anduryl.io.selection_to_text(selection, newline='\n', delimiter='\t')[source]¶

Get elements from model selection and convert to text

Parameters

  • selection (Qt selection) – Selection from a table

  • newline (str, optional) – character for newline, by default

  • delimiter (str, optional) – character for delimiter, by default

Returns

Text that can be exported or pasted

Return type

str

anduryl.io.table_to_csv(model, mainwindow, path=None)[source]¶

Saves table to csv.

Parameters

  • model (table model) – Table model from which the data is retrieved

  • mainwindow (mainwindow) – Is used for retrieving save file name

  • path (str, optional) – Path to save file, if None, the user is asked to provide the save file name

anduryl.io.write_excalibur(project, dttfile, rlsfile)[source]¶

Function to write project experts, items and assessments to .dtt and .rls files.

Results are not writen to the file. Expert names are also not saved.

Parameters

  • project (Project instance) – Project with experts, items and assessments

  • dttfile (str) – Path to .dtt file

  • rlsfile (str) – Path to .rls file

anduryl.io.write_json(project, path)[source]¶

Function to write project experts, items and assessments to .json

Results are not writen to the file. Expert names are also not saved.

Parameters

  • project (Project instance) – Project with experts, items and assessments

  • path (str) – Path to .json file
